Woman caught with over $5 million worth of methamphetamine wrapped in towels at Auckland Airport https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/woman-caught-with-over-5-million-worth-of-methamphetamine-wrapped-in-towels-at-auckland-airport/7VICZ526HZHYLJW3OXA5S3YII4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/woman-caught-with-over-5-million-worth-of-methamphetamine-wrapped-in-towels-at-auckland-airport/7VICZ526HZHYLJW3OXA5S3YII4/ The woman, 27, landed in Auckland on a flight from Vancouver on October 30. Melbourne Cup: Former Napier Boys’ High pupil rides a Kiwi hope https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/melbourne-cup-former-napier-boys-high-pupil-rides-a-kiwi-hope/3QHIDNMS5BEWHO5N6X7GKWLISU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/melbourne-cup-former-napier-boys-high-pupil-rides-a-kiwi-hope/3QHIDNMS5BEWHO5N6X7GKWLISU/ Doug LaingMichael (Mick) Dee has ridden 783 winners, but none yet in the Melbourne Cup. Mon, 04 Nov 2024 04:00:00 +0000 Former Napier Boys' High School pupil Michael Dee celebrating his first win in Hong Kong in May last year. Tomorrow he has his fourth ride in a Melbourne Cup, hoping Sharp 'N' Smart can carry him to his first win in the big race. Photo / HKJC Racing Images
Puku Ora co-founders win Māori businesswomen’s Supreme Award amid school lunch loss https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/puku-ora-co-Founders-win-maori-businesswomens-supreme-award-amid-school-lunch-loss/OLFP44APQ5AXRMJNG66NYWE46U/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/puku-ora-co-Founders-win-maori-businesswomens-supreme-award-amid-school-lunch-loss/OLFP44APQ5AXRMJNG66NYWE46U/ Matai O'Connor, Kaupapa Māori reporterPuku Ora wins Tohu Aorangi award amid loss of school lunch contract to national suppliers. Mon, 04 Nov 2024 04:00:00 +0000 Erana Ngakuru and Amy Wray of Puku Ora won the Pakihi Whai Ora and Supreme Overall awards at the 2024 Māori Women’s Development Inc Māori Businesswomen Awards 2024. Photo / MWDI
Extraordinary meeting to decide Grey St T-intersection safety changes https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/extraordinary-meeting-to-decide-grey-st-t-intersection-safety-changes/GJIAMJBXUZB37H52UVGAVLKHPM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/extraordinary-meeting-to-decide-grey-st-t-intersection-safety-changes/GJIAMJBXUZB37H52UVGAVLKHPM/ Wynsley WrigleyCouncil may approve T-intersection; work to start in November if approved. Trial begins for Destiny Church founder Brian Tamaki, accused of organising illegal Covid-19 protests https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/trial-begins-for-destiny-church-Founder-brian-tamaki-accused-of-organising-illegal-covid-19-protests/GRAJOG2BP5HBHLKZCW3XOG2PQ4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/trial-begins-for-destiny-church-Founder-brian-tamaki-accused-of-organising-illegal-covid-19-protests/GRAJOG2BP5HBHLKZCW3XOG2PQ4/ Craig KapitanThe controversial religious figure risks up to six months' imprisonment if convicted. Mon, 04 Nov 2024 03:42:32 +0000 Destiny Church founder Brian Tamaki, centre, stands in the dock at Auckland District Court as his trial begins for allegedly breaching Covid-19 public health laws. He is joined by co-defendants Jennifer Louise Marshall, left, and Kaleb Cave and wife Hannah Tamaki (obscured). All four are represented by defence lawyer Ron Mansfield KC (foreground). Photo / Mike Scott
